intro: Githopsis pulchella subsp. pulchella, commonly known as the purple-flowered githopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences and vibrant purple to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has small, trifoliate leaves and produces legume-like pods that contain seeds. This subspecies is native to parts of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
